paper_abstract: The Chernoff-Hoeffding bounds are fundamental probabilistic tools. An elementary approach is presented to obtain a Chernoff-type upper-tail bound for the number of prime factors of a random integer in {1, 2, . . . , n}. The method illustrates tail bounds in negatively-correlated settings. (C) 2008 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: A note on the distribution of the number of prime factors of the integers
